data.meta_description: CC Cook (18) P/UTIL  - Graduate transfer who competed for Boston College from 2018-21 and earned her bachelor's degree in psychology with a minor in history ...

Bio

Related

Stats

Biography

Graduate transfer who competed for Boston College from 2018-21 and earned her bachelor's degree in psychology with a minor in history ... graduated Summa Cum Laude and in the top two-percent of her class ... earned the highest GPA of all graduating student-athletes at BC ... has one season of eligibility to play for the Utes.

2022 (Utah): Saw action in 25 games, primarily as a pinch runner... made one appearance in the circle throwing 1.0 innings and striking out one against #13 Arizona State (4/15)... scored 12 runs and was a perfect 2-2 in stolen bases.

2021 (Boston College): Team captain who appeared in 30 games and made 22 starts, including 20 pitching appearances and 13 starts in the circle ... pitched three complete games and was 2-11 with a 4.85 ERA, striking out 46 batters in 73.2 innings pitched ... batted .200 (8-40) with a .514 on-base percentage, and stole two bases in three attempts... hit one double and drove in two runs ... earned Academic Advisor's Award for Excellence, Dean's List First Honors ACC Honor Roll ... graduated with degree in psychology and compiled highest GPA among all graduating student-athletes.

2020 (Boston College): Team captain who appeared in 16 games, making 11 starts … A two-way player, also made seven appearances in the circle with a 1-2 record … Threw 27.1 innings … Struck out 19 batters while allowing 20 hits with a 2.56 ERA ... named Junior Scholar-Athlete of the Year, ACC Honor Roll and earned Dean's List First Honors.

2019 (Boston College): Appeared in 20 games and started four … pitched 37.0 innings, with 15 strikeouts … pitched a season-high 5.2 innings with four strikeouts against NC State on March 31 … pitched in 12 ACC games … saw her first action of the season vs. Northwestern State on Feb. 10 …. also plays the outfield ... Named to the 2018-19 Athletic Director's Award for Academic Achievement list, and was the Sophomore Scholar-Athlete of the Year ... ACC Honor Roll and Dean's List First Honors.

2018 (Boston College): Appeared in 48 games, starting 46, and earned ACC All-Freshman honors, All-ACC Academic Team, ACC Honor Roll and Dean's List First Honors … recorded 139 at-bats, 25 runs, 40 hits, and 25 RBIs … had 10 multi-hit games and 5 multi-RBI games ... Named ACC Player of the Week in March.

HIGH SCHOOL: Named All-Section first team and All-State first team ... named sectional player of the year and the PVUSD District MVP in 2016 ... a 2016 All-Arizona performer, a two-time all-state honoree (2016 first team, 2015 second team) and a two-time all-section honoree (2016 first team, 2015 second team) … led Pinnacle to its first state championship game in 2016 and 2017 ... in 2016 as a junior, led Division 1 with a 0.85 ERA and 237 strikeouts ... played travel ball with the Hotshots Elite for Jason Shepherd for three seasons … helped Hotshots Elite place third at the PGF Nationals in 2016 ... JJ Lipsman Memorial Award ... Dairymen of Arizona All-American Award.

PERSONAL: CC is short for her given name Cierra ... daughter of Bill and Cathy Cook ... has an older sister Alex ... is a member of the National Honor Society and the Society of Women Scholars … earned her bachelor's degree from Boston College in psychology with a minor in history ... Recipient of The Edmund F. Murphy, Jr. '50 & Mary P. Murphy Athletic Scholarship Fund.
